# Draft:Peter Edwards

Peter Edwards
(born August 1963) is a British academic and computer scientist. On 13 October 2025, it was announced that Edwards would assume the role of Principal and Vice-Chancellor of the University of Aberdeen from 1 November 2025. Edwards joined the University in 1988 as a Postdoctoral Research Fellow and has spent his entire academic career at Aberdeen.
Early life and education
Born in Wrexham in August 1963, Edwards attended St Giles Primary School, Ysgol Bryn Offa, and Yale Sixth Form College before leaving North Wales to pursue higher education. He earned an undergraduate degree in Chemistry from Liverpool Polytechnic, followed by a PhD in Computational Chemistry at the University of Leeds. His doctoral thesis, A Cooperative Expert System for Spectra Interpretation, reflected an early interest in the intersection of artificial intelligence and scientific analysis.
Career
While at the University of Leeds, Edwards was part of the Leeds Artificial Intelligence Research (LAIR) community — an experience that shaped his academic trajectory and led him to join the Department of Computing Science at the University of Aberdeen as a postdoctoral researcher in 1988.
Over the following decades, he has held a range of senior academic and leadership roles, including Head of Computing Science, Head of the College of Physical Sciences Graduate School, Director of the Northern Research Partnership Graduate School (a collaboration among the Universities of Aberdeen, Dundee, and Robert Gordon), Head of the School of Natural and Computing Sciences, Vice-Principal for Regional Engagement, and Acting Senior Vice-Principal.
Edwards’ research focuses on the design of intelligent information infrastructures that promote transparency and accountability in computational systems. His work has been highly interdisciplinary, involving collaborations across fields including Medicine, Law, Geography, Transport Studies, Food Science, and Design. He has served as Principal Investigator on several major UK Research Council grants, including the eSocial Science Research Node PolicyGrid (ESRC, 2006–2012).  and the UK Digital Economy Research Hub dot.rural (EPSRC, 2009–2015). The latter focused on user-led digital innovation in rural communities and, during its lifetime, established more than 100 partnerships with public, private, and third-sector organisations, produced over 300 publications, and delivered more than 50 software and technical outputs

Principal and Vice-Chancellor
On 13 October 2025, it was announced that Edwards would assume the role of Principal and Vice-Chancellor of the University of Aberdeen from 1 November 2025. He will be the University’s 15th Principal since the position was established following the 1860 amalgamation of Aberdeen’s two ancient universities: King’s College (founded 1495) and Marischal College (founded 1593).
